intro: Rhabdosciadium, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to Africa and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange composite flowers that resemble daisies. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Rhabdosciadium species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to dry conditions with their succulent leaves and deep root systems. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging climates.
